qas.question: When did the Geneva Declaration of the Right of Children Act pass?
What did the international acts do?

answers.text: encouraged major changes to the workforce

qas.question: What is the age limit now in India for child workers?
What child working conditions are they protected from?

context: International influences help to encourage legal actions to be taken in India, such as the Geneva Declaration of the Right of Children Act was passed in <a0_0>1924<a0_0/>. This act was followed by The Universal Declaration of Human Rights in 1948 to which incorporated the basic human rights and needs of children for proper progression and growth in their younger years. These international acts <a1_0>encouraged major changes to the workforce<a1_0/> in India which occurred in 1986 when the Child Labour (Prohibition and Regulation) Act was put into place. This act prohibited hiring children younger than the age of <a2_0>14<a2_0/>, and from working in <a3_0>hazardous conditions<a3_0/>.
